title: How does the law affect you?

content.title: 1 Voting
content.text: In most countries around the world, including Britain, you can vote from the age of eighteen. In some countries, like Argentina, you have to vote – if you don't, you can go to prison! The youngest voters in the world are in Iran. You can vote there from the age of fifteen. Some politicians in Britain want to change the voting age to sixteen, to involve young people more in politics.
FACT! New Zealand was the first country to give women the vote – in 1893.

content.title: 2 Marriage
content.text: In most of Europe, you are allowed to marry at eighteen (sixteen with your parents' permission). In China, couples need to be more patient – men can't marry before the age of twenty-two and women before twenty.

FACT! In Scotland, young people can marry at sixteen without their parents' permission. That's why, traditionally, young couples run away to Gretna Green (on the English/Scottish border) for 'quickie' weddings.

content.title: 3 Military Service
content.text: In many European countries, young men have to do military service, usually for between three and eighteen months. In Switzerland, men have to go back into the army every year for three weeks. In Britain, there is only a professional army. You can join the army from the age of sixteen.
FACT! If you drop out of high school in Egypt, you have to do four years military service instead!

content.title: 4 Criminal responsibility
content.text: In Britain, you become responsible for crimes you commit from the age of ten. Before that, the law says that you are too young to understand your actions, whether you spray graffiti on a wall, steal sweets or commit murder! In parts of the USA and Australia, this age is just six, while in most European countries, it is fifteen or sixteen.
FACT! Until recently, many US states used the death penalty for criminals under eighteen. Between 1990 and 2005, nineteen young people died in this way.

content.title: 5 Smoking and drinking
content.text: In the UK, it's illegal to buy alcohol until you are eighteen years old (although you're allowed to drink alcohol at home from the age of five!). In the USA, you're not allowed to buy alcohol until you're twenty-one and they are very strict about ID.
FACT! In most US states and in the UK, smoking is banned inside bars and nightclubs and you're not allowed to drink alcohol outside them!

content.title: 6 Driving
content.text: According to UK law, you are not allowed to drive until you are seventeen, while in most of Europe it is eighteen. In the USA, you can drive much younger, in some states from the age of just fourteen!
FACT! Until 1935, you didn't have to take a driving test in the UK – you could just buy a car and drive away!

content.question: At what age can you vote in Iran?
content.feedback: Correct! Iran has the youngest voters in the world at age 15.

content.question: What happens if you don't vote in Argentina?
content.feedback: That's right! Voting is compulsory in Argentina.

content.question: At what age do you become responsible for crimes in Britain?
content.feedback: Correct! In Britain, criminal responsibility starts at age 10.

content.question: In which country can you marry at sixteen without parental permission?
content.feedback: Correct! Scotland allows marriage at 16 without parental consent.

content.question: What is the legal drinking age in the USA?
content.feedback: Correct! In the USA, you must be 21 to buy alcohol.

content.question: At what age can you join the army in Britain?
content.feedback: Correct! You can join the British army from age 16.

content.question: In which country do men return to the army every year for three weeks?
content.feedback: Correct! This is a Swiss military obligation.

content.question: At what age is it legal to drive in most of Europe?
content.feedback: Correct! The driving age in most of Europe is 18.

content.question: What was the driving law in the UK until 1935?
options: You had to take a driving test
You could just buy a car and drive away
content.feedback: Correct! No test was required before 1935 in the UK.

content.question: In which country must you be 22 (men) or 20 (women) to marry?
content.feedback: Correct! These are the marriage ages in China.
